system_workflow_overview.title: Tamabee HR System Overview
system_workflow_overview.content:
**Tamabee HR** is a comprehensive HR management system with these core modules:

- **Employee Management**: Create accounts, contracts, configure salary
- **Attendance**: Record check-in/out, breaks, GPS support, multi-shift
- **Leave**: Submit requests, approve, track leave balance
- **Payroll**: Auto-calculate based on attendance, allowances, deductions, overtime
- **Company Settings**: Configure working hours, breaks, overtime, payroll

Each module is tightly connected. For example: payroll requires attendance data, attendance requires an active contract.

system_workflow_setup_steps.title: Initial Setup Steps
system_workflow_setup_steps.content:
For the system to work correctly, follow this order:

1. **Register company** â€” Create a company account on Tamabee
2. **Company settings** â€” Configure working hours, attendance rules, breaks, overtime
3. **Create departments** â€” Organize your company structure
4. **Create employees** â€” Add employees with email, name, department, role
5. **Create contracts** â€” Each employee needs at least 1 active contract
6. **Configure salary** â€” Set base salary for each employee
7. **Add allowances** â€” Configure allowances (lunch, transport, phone...)
8. **Add deductions** â€” Configure deductions (insurance, tax...)

**Important:** Missing any step will cause dependent features to fail. For example: employees without a contract cannot check in.

system_workflow_employee_onboarding.title: Employee Onboarding Process
system_workflow_employee_onboarding.content:
When adding a new employee, complete all these steps:

1. **Create employee account** â€” Enter email, name, department, role. Employee receives an invitation email with temporary password
2. **Create employment contract** â€” Select contract type (full-time, part-time, seasonal), start/end dates. Contract must be active
3. **Configure salary** â€” Set salary type (monthly, daily, hourly, shift-based) and base amount
4. **Add allowances** â€” Add fixed or conditional allowances
5. **Add deductions** â€” Add fixed or percentage-based deductions

**Why is a contract needed?** The system uses contracts to determine if an employee is currently working. No active contract = cannot check in, cannot calculate payroll.

**Why configure salary?** Without salary configuration, the system cannot calculate base pay. Payslip will show 0.

system_workflow_daily_operations.title: Daily Operations
system_workflow_daily_operations.content:
After setup is complete, daily operations include:

**Employees:**
1. Check in when starting work
2. Start break when resting (if breaks are enabled)
3. End break when returning to work
4. Check out when finishing the shift
5. Submit leave requests if needed

**Managers:**
1. Monitor daily employee attendance
2. Approve attendance adjustment requests
3. Approve leave requests
4. Review attendance reports

system_workflow_monthly_payroll_flow.title: Monthly Payroll Process
system_workflow_monthly_payroll_flow.content:
At the end of each month (or configured cutoff day), the payroll process includes:

1. **Finalize attendance** â€” Ensure all attendance records are accurate, adjustment requests are approved
2. **Create payroll period** â€” System creates a new period with Draft status
3. **Auto-calculate** â€” System calculates based on: base salary, actual working days/hours, allowances, deductions, overtime, breaks (if unpaid)
4. **Review and adjust** â€” Manager reviews payroll, makes adjustments if needed
5. **Approve** â€” Change status to Approved
6. **Payment** â€” Change to paid after payment is made

**Basic formula:**
- Net pay = Base salary + Allowances - Deductions + Overtime - Unpaid breaks (if any)

system_workflow_common_errors.title: Common Errors and Solutions
system_workflow_common_errors.content:
**Error: Cannot check in**
- Cause: Employee has no active contract
- Fix: Create a new contract or activate an existing one

**Error: Salary shows 0**
- Cause: Salary not configured for the employee
- Fix: Go to employee management, select employee, configure salary

**Error: Check-in outside location**
- Cause: Employee is outside the allowed GPS radius
- Fix: Check GPS radius settings or add a new attendance location

**Error: Overtime not calculated**
- Cause: Overtime feature is not enabled
- Fix: Go to Settings > Overtime, enable the feature

**Error: Breaks not recorded**
- Cause: Break feature is not enabled
- Fix: Go to Settings > Breaks, enable the feature

attendance_how_to_checkin.title: How to check in/out
attendance_how_to_checkin.content:
To record your attendance:

1. Go to the **Attendance** page from the main menu
2. Press the **Check In** button when you start working
3. Press the **Check Out** button when you finish your shift

The system will automatically record your time and location.

**Requirements:**
- You must have an active employment contract
- If GPS is required, enable location services and be within the allowed radius
- If fixed working hours are configured, the system will automatically mark late/early leave based on settings

attendance_multi_shift.title: Multi-shift attendance
attendance_multi_shift.content:
If your company uses a shift system, you can check in for multiple shifts per day:

1. Check in/out for the first shift
2. After ending shift 1, the system allows checking in for the next shift
3. Each shift is recorded separately

**Note:** Maximum shifts per day depends on company configuration. Each shift needs clear start and end times.

attendance_view_history.title: View attendance history
attendance_view_history.content:
You can view your attendance history by month:

1. Go to the **Attendance** page
2. Select the month on the calendar
3. Click on a specific date to see check-in/out details

The system shows status for each day: *on time*, *late*, *early leave*, or *absent*. You can also view total working hours and late/early counts for the month.

attendance_request_adjustment.title: Request attendance adjustment
attendance_request_adjustment.content:
If you forgot to check in or need an adjustment:

1. Go to the **Attendance** page and select the date
2. Press the **Request Adjustment** button
3. Enter the correct time and reason
4. Submit the request for manager approval

Your manager will review and approve the request. Once approved, attendance data will be updated automatically.

attendance_geolocation.title: GPS-based attendance
attendance_geolocation.content:
If your company enables GPS location requirement:

1. **Enable location services** on your device before checking in
2. The system checks your location against registered attendance locations
3. You must be within the **allowed radius** to check in successfully

**If check-in fails:**
- Verify location services are enabled
- Ensure you are within the allowed area
- Try reloading the page and checking in again
- Contact your manager if the issue persists

attendance_rounding_rules.title: Time rounding rules
attendance_rounding_rules.content:
The system can round attendance times based on company configuration:

**Rounding intervals:** 5 min, 10 min, 15 min, 30 min, or 60 min

**Rounding directions:**
- **Round up:** 9:07 â†’ 9:10 (with 5-min interval)
- **Round down:** 9:07 â†’ 9:05
- **Round nearest:** 9:07 â†’ 9:05, 9:08 â†’ 9:10

Rounding can be configured separately for: check-in, check-out, break start, break end. Each can have different settings.

breaks_how_breaks_work.title: How breaks work
breaks_how_breaks_work.content:
The break feature allows recording rest time during work shifts.

**How it works:**
1. After checking in, press **Start Break** when you want to rest
2. When returning to work, press **End Break**
3. The system records break time and includes it in reports

**Impact on salary:**
- **Paid breaks:** Break time is still counted as working time
- **Unpaid breaks:** Break time is deducted from working hours, affecting salary

**Note:** Breaks only work when the company has enabled the feature in settings.

breaks_start_end_break.title: Starting and ending breaks
breaks_start_end_break.content:
To record a break:

1. Ensure you have **checked in** first
2. Press the **Start Break** button on the attendance page
3. The system records the break start time
4. When returning to work, press **End Break**
5. The system calculates total break duration

**Important notes:**
- You cannot start a break without checking in first
- You cannot check out while on a break
- Number of breaks per day is limited by company configuration

breaks_break_types.title: Break types
breaks_break_types.content:
The system supports 2 break types:

**1. Paid breaks**
- Rest time is still counted as working hours
- No impact on salary
- Typically for short mid-shift breaks (15-30 minutes)

**2. Unpaid breaks**
- Rest time is deducted from working hours
- Directly impacts salary (less hours = less pay)
- Typically for long lunch breaks (60+ minutes)

**Example:** If hourly rate is [[hourlyRate]]/hour and unpaid break is 60 minutes, salary is reduced by [[hourlyDeduction]] for that day.

breaks_break_compliance.title: Labor law break compliance
breaks_break_compliance.content:
The system supports compliance with labor law break requirements:

**Vietnam labor law:**
- 8 continuous working hours: minimum 30-minute break
- Night shift (22:00-06:00): minimum 45-minute break

**Japan labor law:**
- Over 6 working hours: minimum 45-minute break
- Over 8 working hours: minimum 60-minute break

The system can automatically apply minimum break times based on locale (vi/ja) if *Use legal minimum* is enabled in settings.

breaks_break_adjustment.title: Fixed and flexible break modes
breaks_break_adjustment.content:
Companies can configure breaks in 2 modes:

**Fixed mode:**
- Break times are predetermined (e.g., 12:00-13:00)
- Employees must take breaks at specified times
- Suitable for companies with strict break schedules

**Flexible mode:**
- Employees choose when to take breaks
- Just need to meet total break time requirements
- Suitable for companies with flexible work culture

**Night shifts:** The system has separate configuration for night shifts (22:00-05:00) with different minimum and default break times.

shifts_overview.title: What are work shifts
shifts_overview.content:
The shift feature allows companies to create and manage different work shifts:

**Key components:**
- **Shift templates:** Define shift name, start time, end time, color
- **Shift assignments:** Assign employees to specific shifts by date
- **Shift swaps:** Employees can request to swap shifts with colleagues

**Example templates:**
- Morning shift: 06:00 - 14:00
- Afternoon shift: 14:00 - 22:00
- Night shift: 22:00 - 06:00

**Note:** Shift management must be set up by administrators before employees can view their schedules.

shifts_view_schedule.title: View shift schedule
shifts_view_schedule.content:
To view your shift schedule:

1. Go to the **Work Schedule** page from the main menu
2. View your shifts by week or month on the calendar
3. Click on a specific date to see shift details

The system shows: *shift name*, *start/end time*, *status* for each day. You can also view your swap request history.

shifts_swap_request.title: Request shift swap
shifts_swap_request.content:
If you want to swap shifts with a colleague:

1. Go to the **Work Schedule** page
2. Select the shift you want to swap
3. Press **Request Swap**
4. Select a colleague's shift to swap with
5. Enter the reason and submit

The request will be sent to your manager for approval. Once approved, both schedules will be updated automatically.

**Notes:**
- You can only swap shifts that haven't occurred yet
- You can cancel a swap request while it's still pending

shifts_manage_templates.title: Manage shift templates
shifts_manage_templates.content:
To create and manage shift templates:

1. Go to **Dashboard** > **Shifts** > **Templates**
2. Press **Create New Template**
3. Enter information:
- **Shift name:** e.g., Morning, Afternoon, Night
- **Start/end time:** Working hours for the shift
- **Color:** To distinguish on the calendar
- **Description:** Additional notes (optional)
4. Press **Save**

You can edit or deactivate any template at any time. Deactivated templates won't appear when assigning shifts.

shifts_assign_shifts.title: Assign shifts to employees
shifts_assign_shifts.content:
To assign shifts:

1. Go to **Shifts** > **Assignments**
2. Select employees and shift template
3. Select date or date range
4. Press **Assign**

**Batch assignment:** You can select multiple employees at once and assign shifts for a date range. The system will automatically create assignments for each day.

**Notes:**
- Each employee can only be assigned 1 shift per day
- You can batch delete assignments by employee and date range

shifts_approve_swaps.title: Approve shift swap requests
shifts_approve_swaps.content:
To approve swap requests:

1. Go to **Shifts** > **Swap Requests**
2. View the list of pending requests
3. Click on a request to see details (who is swapping with whom, which shifts, which dates)
4. Select **Approve** or **Reject**

After approval, both employees' schedules will be swapped automatically. Employees will receive a notification about the result.

leave_request_leave.title: How to request leave
leave_request_leave.content:
To request leave:

1. Go to the **Leave** page
2. Press the **Create Leave Request** button
3. Select leave type, start and end dates
4. Enter the reason for leave
5. Press **Submit**

The leave request will be sent to your manager for approval. You will receive a notification when it is approved or rejected.

leave_leave_types.title: Leave types
leave_leave_types.content:
The system supports these leave types:

- **Annual leave:** Paid leave as per regulations
- **Sick leave:** Leave due to illness, may require medical certificate
- **Maternity leave:** For pregnant employees
- **Paternity leave:** For male employees when spouse gives birth
- **Bereavement leave:** Leave when a family member passes away
- **Unpaid leave:** Leave without pay
- **Other:** Other leave types

Leave days for each type depend on company policy and employment contract.

leave_check_balance.title: Check remaining leave balance
leave_check_balance.content:
To check your remaining leave days:

1. Go to the **Leave** page
2. View the summary at the top of the page

The system shows: *total leave days*, *used*, and *remaining* for each leave type.

leave_cancel_leave.title: Cancel leave request
leave_cancel_leave.content:
You can cancel a pending leave request:

1. Go to the **Leave** page
2. Find the leave request you want to cancel
3. Press the **Cancel** button

**Note:** You can only cancel requests with *Pending* status. Approved requests require contacting your manager.

payroll_view_payslip.title: View payslip
payroll_view_payslip.content:
To view your monthly payslip:

1. Go to the **Payroll** page
2. Select the month
3. Click on the payslip to view details

The payslip includes: *base salary*, *allowances*, *deductions*, *overtime*, *unpaid breaks (if any)*, and *net pay*.

payroll_salary_components.title: Salary components
payroll_salary_components.content:
Your salary consists of:

- **Base salary**: Salary per contract (monthly, daily, hourly, or shift-based)
- **Allowances**: Additional benefits (lunch, transport, phone, housing...)
- **Deductions**: Social insurance, income tax, and other deductions
- **Overtime**: Overtime pay calculated with multipliers (x1.25, x1.5...)
- **Unpaid breaks**: Unpaid break time deducted from salary
- **Net pay**: Actual amount received after all calculations

**Formula:** Net pay = Base salary + Allowances - Deductions + Overtime - Unpaid breaks

payroll_overtime_calculation.title: Overtime calculation
payroll_overtime_calculation.content:
Overtime is calculated when employees work beyond standard hours:

**Overtime multipliers:**
- **Regular overtime:** x1.25 (extra hours on normal days)
- **Night work:** x1.25 (working 22:00-05:00)
- **Night overtime:** x1.50 (overtime during night hours)
- **Holiday overtime:** x1.35 (extra hours on holidays)
- **Holiday night overtime:** x1.60 (night overtime on holidays)

**Example:** Hourly rate [[hourlyRate]], regular overtime 2 hours = [[overtimeResult]]

**Note:** Overtime multipliers can be customized by the company. The system also supports applying legal minimums per Vietnam or Japan labor law.

payroll_break_deduction.title: Break deduction from salary
payroll_break_deduction.content:
If the company configures breaks as **unpaid**, break time is deducted from salary:

**Calculation:**
- System totals all unpaid break time for the month
- Converts to hours and deducts from total working hours
- Salary is reduced accordingly

**Example:**
- Monthly salary: [[monthlySalary]] (22 days, 8 hours/day = 176 hours)
- Hourly rate: [[monthlyHourly]]/hour
- Unpaid breaks: 60 min/day x 22 days = 22 hours
- Deduction: [[breakDeduction]]

**If breaks are paid:** No salary deduction, break time counts as working hours.

profile_update_profile.title: Update personal information
profile_update_profile.content:
To update your profile:

1. Click on your **avatar** in the top right corner
2. Select **Personal Profile**
3. Update the necessary information
4. Press **Save**

You can update: *name*, *phone number*, *address*, *avatar*, and *emergency contact information*.

profile_change_language.title: Change language
profile_change_language.content:
The system supports 3 languages: Tiáº¿ng Viá»‡t, English, æ—¥æœ¬èªž.

To change the language:

1. Click on your **avatar** in the top right corner
2. Select the desired language from the menu

The system will automatically switch the entire interface to the selected language.

profile_bank_info.title: Update bank information
profile_bank_info.content:
To update your bank account for salary payment:

1. Go to **Personal Profile**
2. Find the **Bank Information** section
3. Enter your bank account details
4. Press **Save**

**Note:** Accurate bank information is essential for receiving your salary on time.

employee_management_create_employee.title: Create new employee
employee_management_create_employee.content:
To add a new employee:

1. Go to **Dashboard** > **Employees**
2. Press the **Add Employee** button
3. Enter information: email, name, department, role
4. Press **Create**

The employee will receive an invitation email with a temporary password.

**Important:** After creating the employee, you need to create a contract and configure salary for full functionality.

employee_management_contract_setup.title: Create employment contract
employee_management_contract_setup.content:
Each employee needs at least 1 active contract:

1. Go to **Employee Management** > select employee
2. Select the **Contracts** tab
3. Press **Create New Contract**
4. Select type: Full-time, Part-time, Seasonal, Contract
5. Enter start date, end date (if applicable)
6. Press **Save**

**Why is a contract needed?**
- Contracts determine if an employee is currently working
- No active contract = cannot check in
- Expired contracts automatically change to expired status

employee_management_salary_config.title: Configure employee salary
employee_management_salary_config.content:
After creating a contract, configure salary:

1. Go to **Employee Management** > select employee
2. Select the **Salary** tab
3. Choose salary type: Monthly, Daily, Hourly, Shift-based
4. Enter base salary amount
5. Press **Save**

**Salary type affects calculation:**
- **Monthly:** Fixed salary, deducted for unauthorized absences
- **Daily:** Salary = working days x daily rate
- **Hourly:** Salary = working hours x hourly rate
- **Shift-based:** Salary = shifts worked x shift rate

employee_management_allowance_deduction.title: Allowances and deductions
employee_management_allowance_deduction.content:
**Allowances:**
1. Go to employee > **Allowances** tab
2. Press **Add Allowance**
3. Select type: Fixed, Conditional, One-time
4. Enter name and amount

**Deductions:**
1. Go to employee > **Deductions** tab
2. Press **Add Deduction**
3. Select type: Fixed or Percentage
4. Enter name and amount/percentage

**Allowance examples:** Lunch [[lunchAllowance]]/month, Transport [[transportAllowance]]/month
**Deduction examples:** Social insurance 8%, Health insurance 1.5%

employee_management_manage_attendance.title: Manage employee attendance
employee_management_manage_attendance.content:
To manage attendance:

1. Go to **Dashboard** > **Attendance**
2. View attendance overview by day/month
3. Review adjustment requests from employees

You can view detailed attendance for each employee including check-in/out, breaks, overtime, and export reports.

employee_management_approve_leave.title: Approve leave requests
employee_management_approve_leave.content:
To approve leave requests:

1. Go to **Dashboard** > **Leave**
2. View the list of pending requests
3. Click on a request to view details
4. Select **Approve** or **Reject**

The employee will receive a notification about the approval result.

employee_management_manage_payroll.title: Manage payroll
employee_management_manage_payroll.content:
To manage employee payroll:

1. Go to **Dashboard** > **Payroll**
2. Select the month for payroll calculation
3. View the payroll summary
4. Review and confirm the payroll

The system automatically calculates salary based on attendance, allowances, deductions, overtime and breaks. Payroll period status: Draft â†’ Reviewing â†’ Approved â†’ paid.

company_settings_attendance_settings.title: Attendance settings
company_settings_attendance_settings.content:
To configure attendance rules:

1. Go to **Dashboard** > **Settings**
2. Select the **Attendance** tab
3. Configure:
- **Working hours:** Default start and end times
- **Late grace:** Minutes allowed for late arrival
- **Early leave grace:** Minutes allowed for early departure
- **GPS required:** Enable/disable location requirement
- **GPS radius:** Maximum distance for check-in
- **Weekend off:** Configure Saturday and Sunday as off days
- **Time rounding:** Configure rounding rules for check-in/out
4. Press **Save**

Changes apply to all employees in the company.

company_settings_break_settings.title: Break settings
company_settings_break_settings.content:
To configure breaks:

1. Go to **Settings** > **Breaks** tab
2. Enable/disable break feature
3. Configure:
- **Break type:** paid or unpaid
- **Default duration:** Default break minutes
- **Min/max duration:** Break time limits
- **Max breaks/day:** Daily break count limit
- **Fixed mode:** Enable for predetermined break schedules
- **Legal compliance:** Enable to apply legal minimum break times
- **Night shift:** Separate configuration for night shifts (22:00-05:00)
4. Press **Save**

company_settings_overtime_settings.title: Overtime settings
company_settings_overtime_settings.content:
To configure overtime:

1. Go to **Settings** > **Overtime** tab
2. Enable/disable overtime feature
3. Configure:
- **Standard hours:** Hours before overtime kicks in
- **Regular overtime rate:** Default x1.25
- **Night work rate:** Default x1.25
- **Night overtime rate:** Default x1.50
- **Holiday overtime rate:** Default x1.35
- **Holiday night overtime rate:** Default x1.60
- **Overtime limits:** Max hours/day and hours/month
- **Require approval:** Enable if overtime needs manager approval
4. Press **Save**

The system supports applying legal minimums per Vietnam or Japan labor law.

company_settings_payroll_settings.title: Payroll settings
company_settings_payroll_settings.content:
To configure payroll policies:

1. Go to **Settings** > **Payroll** tab
2. Configure:
- **Pay day:** Day of month for salary payment (e.g., 25th)
- **Cutoff day:** Day to finalize attendance data (e.g., 20th)
- **Default salary type:** monthly, daily, hourly, or shift-based
- **Standard working days/month:** Used for daily salary calculation
- **Standard working hours/day:** Used for hourly salary calculation
- **Salary rounding:** Rounding direction for salary calculation
3. Press **Save**

company_settings_department_settings.title: Department management
company_settings_department_settings.content:
To manage department structure:

1. Go to **Dashboard** > **Departments**
2. Add, edit, or delete departments
3. Assign employees to departments

Each employee belongs to one department. Departments help organize HR management and support filtering reports by department.

platform_admin_manage_companies.title: Manage companies
platform_admin_manage_companies.content:
To manage companies on the platform:

1. Go to **Admin** > **Companies**
2. View the list of active companies
3. Click on a company to view details

You can view information, status, and service plans for each company.

platform_admin_deposit_management.title: Deposit management
platform_admin_deposit_management.content:
To process deposit requests:

1. Go to **Admin** > **Deposits**
2. View the list of deposit requests
3. Verify transfer information
4. **Approve** or **Reject** the request

After approval, the company's wallet balance will be updated automatically.

platform_admin_plan_management.title: Service plan management
platform_admin_plan_management.content:
To manage service plans:

1. Go to **Admin** > **Service Plans**
2. View existing plans
3. Create new or edit service plans

Each plan includes: *plan name*, *price*, *features*, and *employee limit*.
